content.text:
Perfect! Now I have all the information I need. Let me compile a comprehensive report for you.

## Documentation Website Exploration Report

I've thoroughly explored the chkit documentation website. Here's what I found:

### 1. Framework Being Used

**Astro + Starlight** (v0.37.6)
- Astro: ^5.6.1
- @astrojs/starlight: ^0.37.6

Starlight is a documentation framework built on top of Astro specifically designed for creating beautiful documentation websites.

### 2. Styling Approach

The styling uses a **CSS Custom Properties (CSS Variables)** system with CSS Cascade Layers for organization:

**Starlight CSS Files** (`/Users/marc/conductor/workspaces/chkit/davao/apps/docs/node_modules/@astrojs/starlight/style/`):
- `props.css` - Defines all design tokens and CSS variables
- `reset.css` - Base reset and HTML/body styles
- `markdown.css` - Markdown content styling
- `asides.css` - Aside/callout styling
- `anchor-links.css` - Heading anchor link styles
- `print.css` - Print media styles
- `util.css` - Utility styles
- `layers.css` - CSS layer organization

**Key Features:**
- No Tailwind CSS - pure CSS with variables
- CSS Cascade Layers for organizing styles (`@layer starlight.base`, `@layer starlight.content`, etc.)
- Dark mode default with light mode override using `data-theme` attribute
- Responsive design using media queries (50em, 72em breakpoints)

### 3. Directory Structure

```
/apps/docs/
├── astro.config.mjs                    (Starlight config)
├── package.json
├── tsconfig.json
├── README.md
├── public/
│   └── favicon.svg
├── src/
│   ├── assets/
│   │   └── houston.webp               (Default Astro mascot image)
│   ├── content/
│   │   └── docs/
│   │       ├── index.mdx              (Home page with splash template)
│   │       ├── getting-started.md
│   │       ├── documentation-structure.md
│   │       ├── cli/
│   │       │   └── overview.md
│   │       ├── configuration/
│   │       │   └── overview.md
│   │       └── plugins/
│   │           └── codegen.md
│   └── content.config.ts              (Astro content collection config)
```

**No custom Astro components or CSS overrides** - Using Starlight defaults entirely.

### 4. Color Scheme and Theme Configuration

**Default Accent Color:**
- Dark Mode: Blue (hsl(224, 100%, 60%)) - accent variations at different lightness levels
- Light Mode: Blue (hsl(234, 90%, 60%)) - slightly different hue angle

**Comprehensive Color Palette:**

**Dark Mode (default):**
- Grays: 6-level scale from near-black to near-white
- Colors: Orange, Green, Blue, Purple, Red (each with low/normal/high variants)
- Accent: Blue-based with specific low/normal/high variants
- Text: Gray-2 on black background
- Backgrounds: Black for page, Gray-6 for nav/sidebar
- Shadows: 3 levels (sm, md, lg)

**Light Mode (via `data-theme="light"`):**
- Colors inverted appropriately
- Text colors adjusted for white backgrounds
- Shadow opacity reduced

**Current Config in astro.config.mjs:**
```javascript
starlight({
  title: 'chkit Docs',
  description: 'Public documentation for chkit, the ClickHouse schema and migration CLI.',
  // Using Starlight defaults - no custom colors defined
})
```

To customize colors, the config would accept:
- `customCss` for overriding CSS variables
- `logo`, `head`, etc. for branding

### 5. Layout Components and Styling Application

**Starlight Provides These Components:**
- `Page.astro` - Main page layout wrapper
- `PageFrame.astro` - Frame with sidebar/nav
- `Header.astro` - Top navigation bar
- `Sidebar.astro` - Left sidebar navigation
- `TableOfContents.astro` / `MobileTableOfContents.astro` - TOC generation
- `MarkdownContent.astro` - Markdown rendering wrapper
- `Card` & `CardGrid` - Reusable UI components (used in index.mdx)
- `Hero.astro` - Hero section (splash template)
- `Banner.astro` - Top banner component
- `Footer.astro` - Footer component
- `Search.astro` - Search functionality
- `ThemeSelect.astro` - Light/dark mode toggle
- `LanguageSelect.astro` - Language switcher

**Styling Application:**
- CSS Variables define all design tokens
- Starlight handles responsive layouts automatically:
  - Mobile: Hamburger menu, stacked layout
  - Tablet (50em+): Desktop sidebar visible
  - Desktop (72em+): Full multi-column layout
- Content width fixed at 45rem with 1rem padding
- Sidebar width: 18.75rem
- Navigation height: 3.5rem (mobile) / 4rem (desktop)

**Typography:**
- Sans-serif font stack: `ui-sans-serif, system-ui, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, etc.`
- Monospace: `ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, etc.`
- 9 text size scales from 12px to 64px
- Line height: 1.75 (body), 1.2 (headings)

### 6. Key CSS Variables Used

Over 50 CSS variables control the entire design:
- `--sl-color-*` - All colors
- `--sl-text-*` - Font sizes
- `--sl-font-*` - Font families
- `--sl-shadow-*` - Shadow definitions
- `--sl-nav-*` - Navigation dimensions
- `--sl-sidebar-*` - Sidebar dimensions
- `--sl-content-*` - Content area dimensions
- `--sl-z-index-*` - Stacking contexts

All variables are defined in `/Users/marc/conductor/workspaces/chkit/davao/apps/docs/node_modules/@astrojs/starlight/style/props.css`

### Summary

The chkit docs is a **minimal, elegant setup** using Starlight's sensible defaults with no custom styling. It's:
- Pre-built documentation framework (no configuration needed)
- Dark-first design with light mode support
- Fully responsive without media query tweaking
- Uses CSS variables for complete theming capability
- Leverages Starlight's components (Card, CardGrid, Hero) for rich content
- Zero custom CSS or components needed currently

To customize the styling, you would modify the `astro.config.mjs` file to add color overrides, custom CSS, or additional configuration options that Starlight supports.

Perfect! Now I have a comprehensive understanding of the styling approach. Let me compile the report.

## Comprehensive Styling Analysis: ObsessionDB Landing Page

Based on my thorough exploration of the `/Users/marc/Workspace/ob-db` repository, here's a complete breakdown of the styling approach and design system:

---

### 1. **Overall Styling Approach**

**Framework**: **Tailwind CSS v4.1.18** with **Tailwind Vite plugin**
- Uses `@tailwindcss/vite` v4.1.18 for integration
- Vite-based build system with React 19
- **No traditional tailwind.config.ts** — uses Tailwind CSS v4's new theme config via `@theme` in CSS

**CSS Architecture**:
- Single entry point: `/Users/marc/Workspace/ob-db/src/index.css`
- Imports Tailwind via `@import "tailwindcss"`
- Custom design tokens defined in `@theme` block
- Component-level inline styles for complex animations and gradients
- Motion library (Framer Motion alternative) for animations

---

### 2. **Design Tokens & Color Palette**

**Defined in `/src/index.css` @theme block:**

```css
--font-geist: "Geist", sans-serif;
--color-ob-bg: #0D0D0D;           /* Dark background */
--color-ob-light: #E8E7E3;        /* Light neutral (buttons) */
--color-ob-dark: #272727;         /* Dark neutral */
--color-ob-text-dark: #170A16;    /* Text on light bg */
--color-ob-subtitle: #808080;     /* Subtitle gray */
```

**Color Palette Summary:**
- **Primary Background**: `#0D0D0D` (near-black, very dark gray)
- **Light Accent**: `#E8E7E3` (warm off-white)
- **Light Button Variant**: Uses `bg-ob-light` + `text-ob-text-dark` (#170A16)
- **Dark Button Variant**: Uses `bg-ob-dark` + `text-ob-light`
- **Text Colors**: Extensive use of opacity modifiers:
  - `text-white/90`, `text-white/70`, `text-white/45`, `text-white/30`, `text-white/20`, `text-white/25`, `text-white/35`, `text-white/50`
  - `text-ob-light/70`, `text-ob-light/60` for dimmed states
- **Accent Colors**: Pink/magenta for LEDs and button hovers: `rgba(254,0,122,0.x)` (#FE007A)

---

### 3. **Typography System**

**Font Family**: **Geist** (custom variable font)
- Loaded from `/public/fonts/Geist-Variable.woff2`
- Font weight range: 100-900
- Font display: swap

**Typography Usage Patterns** (from components):
- **H1 (Hero)**: `text-[40.5px] font-semibold leading-[1.04] tracking-[-0.03em]`
- **H2 (Section headers)**: `text-[57.5px] max-md:text-[32px] font-semibold leading-[1.04] tracking-[-0.03em]`
- **H2 (Modals)**: `text-[22px] sm:text-[24px] font-semibold leading-snug tracking-[-0.01em]`
- **Body text**: `text-[14px]` or `text-[13px] leading-[1.65]`
- **Captions**: `text-[11px] tracking-[0.04em] uppercase font-mono` (for labels)
- **Small/meta**: `text-[10px]` or `text-[12px]`

**Font Weights Used**: 300 (normal), 500 (medium), 600 (semibold), 700 (bold)

**Text Rendering**:
- Heavy use of **gradient text** with `background: linear-gradient(...)` + `WebkitBackgroundClip: text`
- Primary gradient: `linear-gradient(91.41deg, #FFFFFF 0%, rgba(255,255,255,0.9) 50%, rgba(255,255,255,0.7) 100%)`
- Letter spacing: `-0.03em`, `-0.01em`, `0.04em`, `0.06em`, `tracking-widest`

---

### 4. **Key CSS Classes & Patterns**

**Button Classes** (from `/src/components/Button.tsx`):
```javascript
// Shared button styling
'flex items-center justify-between w-[208px] h-[37px] rounded-[13.5px] px-4 font-semibold text-[11.92px] leading-5 uppercase'

// Light variant
'bg-ob-light text-ob-text-dark shadow-[inset_0px_-2px_4px_rgba(0,0,0,0.08),inset_0px_1px_1.1px_rgba(255,255,255,0.35)]'

// Dark variant
'bg-ob-dark text-ob-light shadow-[inset_0px_-2px_4px_rgba(0,0,0,0.29),inset_0px_1px_1.1px_rgba(255,255,255,0.19)]'
```

**Panel Surface Class** (reusable component styling):
```css
.panel-surface {
  position: relative;
  isolation: isolate;
}

.panel-surface::after {
  /* Fractal noise texture overlay */
  content: '';
  background: url("data:image/svg+xml,..."); /* SVG noise filter */
  opacity: 0.03;
  mix-blend-mode: overlay;
  pointer-events: none;
}
```

**Modal/Dialog Styling**:
- Background: `#141414` (slightly lighter than main bg)
- Border: `1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.08)`
- Shadow: `0 24px 80px rgba(0,0,0,0.6), 0 0 1px rgba(255,255,255,0.05)`
- Rounded: `sm:rounded-[16px]`
- Backdrop: `bg-black/70 backdrop-blur-sm`

**Form Inputs** (from ContactModal):
```javascript
// Shared class
'w-full rounded-[10px] px-4 py-3 text-[13px] font-geist text-white/80 placeholder:text-white/20 outline-none transition-all duration-200'

// Inline style
{
  background: 'radial-gradient(ellipse at 50% 0%, #1e1e1e 0%, #161616 100%)',
  border: '1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.06)',
  boxShadow: 'inset 0 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.3), inset 0 -1px 0 rgba(255,255,255,0.03)',
}
```

**Navigation Classes**:
- Base nav: `absolute top-0 left-0 right-0 z-[101]`
- Inner container: `mx-auto max-w-[1200px] rounded-xl px-6 py-3 flex items-center justify-between`
- Hover state: `md:group-hover:bg-[#1a1a1a]/95 md:group-hover:backdrop-blur-md`
- Mobile nav: `fixed inset-0 z-[100] bg-ob-bg flex flex-col`

---

### 5. **Animation & Effects**

**Custom Keyframes** (in `/src/index.css`):

```css
@keyframes breathe {
  0%, 100% { opacity: 0.5; }
  50% { opacity: 0.7; }
}

@keyframes led-glow {
  0%, 100% { box-shadow: 0 0 4px rgba(254,0,122,0.5), 0 0 8px rgba(254,0,122,0.15); }
  50% { box-shadow: 0 0 6px rgba(254,0,122,0.7), 0 0 12px rgba(254,0,122,0.25); }
}

/* Applied classes */
.node-dot { animation: breathe 3s ease-in-out infinite; }
.status-led { animation: led-glow 2s ease-in-out infinite; }
```

**Button Interactions** (`.cta-btn`):
```css
.cta-btn {
  transition: all 0.15s ease;
}

.cta-btn:hover {
  transform: translateY(-1px);
  filter: brightness(1.05);
  box-shadow: inset 0 1px 0 rgba(255,255,255,0.3),
              inset 0 -2px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15),
              0 6px 20px rgba(254,0,122,0.35),
              0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.4);
}

.cta-btn:active {
  transform: translateY(1px);
  filter: brightness(0.97);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.2),
              0 1px 4px rgba(254,0,122,0.15),
              0 1px 2px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);
}
```

**Motion Library Patterns** (from framer motion alternative):
- `initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 6 }}`
- `animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }}`
- `exit={{ opacity: 0, y: -6 }}`
- `transition={{ duration: 0.2 }}`
- Stagger animations: `staggerChildren: 0.08`

**Reduced Motion Support**:
```css
@media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) {
  *, *::before, *::after {
    animation-duration: 0.01ms !important;
    transition-duration: 0.01ms !important;
  }
}
```

---

### 6. **Spacing & Layout Patterns**

**Container Max-Width**: `max-w-[1200px]`

**Common Spacing**:
- Section padding: `px-6 py-16 md:py-32` or `px-6 pt-40 pb-10`
- Gap values: `gap-3`, `gap-4`, `gap-6`, `gap-8`, `gap-1.5`
- Padding: `px-4 py-3`, `px-6 py-4`, `p-5 sm:p-7`, `p-6 sm:p-8`

**Responsive Patterns**:
- Mobile-first with `max-md:`, `md:`, `max-sm:`, `sm:` breakpoints
- Example: `text-[32px] md:text-[57.5px]`
- Flex wrapping: `flex-col md:flex-row`

**Grid Layouts** (Comparisons modal):
```javascript
className="grid grid-cols-[72px_1fr_1fr] sm:grid-cols-[140px_1fr_1fr] gap-2 sm:gap-4"
```

---

### 7. **Visual Theme & Brand Identity**

**Theme**: **Dark mode dominated** with metallic/skeuomorphic accents

**Primary Visual Characteristics**:
1. **Very dark background** (#0D0D0D) — almost black
2. **High contrast text** — white with opacity variations for hierarchy
3. **Gradient text** — glossy white-to-transparent gradients for headings
4. **Metallic elements** — used in buttons, success states, and metal emblem effects
5. **Noise texture overlay** — subtle fractal noise on panels (`.panel-surface::after`)
6. **Pink/Magenta accents** (#FE007A) — for interactive states and LEDs
7. **Soft shadows** — inset shadows for depth, outer shadows for floating elements
8. **Smooth blur effects** — `backdrop-blur-md` on hover states

**Metal/Skeuomorphic Styling** (Success state):
```javascript
// Metal emblem background
background: 'radial-gradient(ellipse at 40% 30%, #c0c0c0 0%, #999 40%, #707070 80%, #585858 100%)',
boxShadow: 'inset 0 2px 0 rgba(255,255,255,0.4), inset 0 -2px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.2), 0 4px 16px rgba(0,0,0,0.5)',

// Metal plate with engraving
background: 'linear-gradient(145deg, #bfbfbf 0%, #a6a6a6 35%, #969696 60%, #8a8a8a 100%)',
boxShadow: 'inset 0 1px 0 rgba(255,255,255,0.35), inset 0 -2px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.12), 0 4px 20px rgba(0,0,0,0.5)',
textShadow: '0 1px 0 rgba(255,255,255,0.5), 0 -0.5px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15)',
```

---

### 8. **Special Effects & Advanced Styling**

**Beam/Light Effect** (Hero section):
- Polygonal clip paths for directional light beams
- Radial gradients for glow effects
- Blur filters on layered divs
- Calculated positions using JavaScript

**Dot Grid** (Background):
- Uses `@paper-design/shaders-react` DotGrid component
- Perspective transforms and 3D rotation
- Smooth animation transitions (600ms easing)
- Dynamic scaling based on hover state

**Smooth Scrolling**:
- Integrated **Lenis** smooth scroll library
- Applied globally via `new Lenis()` in App.tsx

**Code Terminal Styling** (CodeSnippet component):
```javascript
const PROMPT = 'select-none text-white/35'
const SYS = 'text-white/35'
const OP = 'text-white/50'
const ACCENT = 'text-white/90'
const KW = 'text-white font-bold'
const FN = 'text-white/70'
const BORDER = 'text-white/20'
```

---

## Comprehensive Styling Analysis: ObsessionDB Landing Page

Based on my thorough exploration of the `/Users/marc/Workspace/ob-db` repository, here's a complete breakdown of the styling approach and design system:

---

### 1. **Overall Styling Approach**

**Framework**: **Tailwind CSS v4.1.18** with **Tailwind Vite plugin**
- Uses `@tailwindcss/vite` v4.1.18 for integration
- Vite-based build system with React 19
- **No traditional tailwind.config.ts** — uses Tailwind CSS v4's new theme config via `@theme` in CSS

**CSS Architecture**:
- Single entry point: `/Users/marc/Workspace/ob-db/src/index.css`
- Imports Tailwind via `@import "tailwindcss"`
- Custom design tokens defined in `@theme` block
- Component-level inline styles for complex animations and gradients
- Motion library (Framer Motion alternative) for animations

---

### 2. **Design Tokens & Color Palette**

**Defined in `/src/index.css` @theme block:**

```css
--font-geist: "Geist", sans-serif;
--color-ob-bg: #0D0D0D;           /* Dark background */
--color-ob-light: #E8E7E3;        /* Light neutral (buttons) */
--color-ob-dark: #272727;         /* Dark neutral */
--color-ob-text-dark: #170A16;    /* Text on light bg */
--color-ob-subtitle: #808080;     /* Subtitle gray */
```

**Color Palette Summary:**
- **Primary Background**: `#0D0D0D` (near-black, very dark gray)
- **Light Accent**: `#E8E7E3` (warm off-white)
- **Light Button Variant**: Uses `bg-ob-light` + `text-ob-text-dark` (#170A16)
- **Dark Button Variant**: Uses `bg-ob-dark` + `text-ob-light`
- **Text Colors**: Extensive use of opacity modifiers:
  - `text-white/90`, `text-white/70`, `text-white/45`, `text-white/30`, `text-white/20`, `text-white/25`, `text-white/35`, `text-white/50`
  - `text-ob-light/70`, `text-ob-light/60` for dimmed states
- **Accent Colors**: Pink/magenta for LEDs and button hovers: `rgba(254,0,122,0.x)` (#FE007A)

---

### 3. **Typography System**

**Font Family**: **Geist** (custom variable font)
- Loaded from `/public/fonts/Geist-Variable.woff2`
- Font weight range: 100-900
- Font display: swap

**Typography Usage Patterns** (from components):
- **H1 (Hero)**: `text-[40.5px] font-semibold leading-[1.04] tracking-[-0.03em]`
- **H2 (Section headers)**: `text-[57.5px] max-md:text-[32px] font-semibold leading-[1.04] tracking-[-0.03em]`
- **H2 (Modals)**: `text-[22px] sm:text-[24px] font-semibold leading-snug tracking-[-0.01em]`
- **Body text**: `text-[14px]` or `text-[13px] leading-[1.65]`
- **Captions**: `text-[11px] tracking-[0.04em] uppercase font-mono` (for labels)
- **Small/meta**: `text-[10px]` or `text-[12px]`

**Font Weights Used**: 300 (normal), 500 (medium), 600 (semibold), 700 (bold)

**Text Rendering**:
- Heavy use of **gradient text** with `background: linear-gradient(...)` + `WebkitBackgroundClip: text`
- Primary gradient: `linear-gradient(91.41deg, #FFFFFF 0%, rgba(255,255,255,0.9) 50%, rgba(255,255,255,0.7) 100%)`
- Letter spacing: `-0.03em`, `-0.01em`, `0.04em`, `0.06em`, `tracking-widest`

---

### 4. **Key CSS Classes & Patterns**

**Button Classes** (from `/src/components/Button.tsx`):
```javascript
// Shared button styling
'flex items-center justify-between w-[208px] h-[37px] rounded-[13.5px] px-4 font-semibold text-[11.92px] leading-5 uppercase'

// Light variant
'bg-ob-light text-ob-text-dark shadow-[inset_0px_-2px_4px_rgba(0,0,0,0.08),inset_0px_1px_1.1px_rgba(255,255,255,0.35)]'

// Dark variant
'bg-ob-dark text-ob-light shadow-[inset_0px_-2px_4px_rgba(0,0,0,0.29),inset_0px_1px_1.1px_rgba(255,255,255,0.19)]'
```

**Panel Surface Class** (reusable component styling):
```css
.panel-surface {
  position: relative;
  isolation: isolate;
}

.panel-surface::after {
  /* Fractal noise texture overlay */
  content: '';
  background: url("data:image/svg+xml,..."); /* SVG noise filter */
  opacity: 0.03;
  mix-blend-mode: overlay;
  pointer-events: none;
}
```

**Modal/Dialog Styling**:
- Background: `#141414` (slightly lighter than main bg)
- Border: `1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.08)`
- Shadow: `0 24px 80px rgba(0,0,0,0.6), 0 0 1px rgba(255,255,255,0.05)`
- Rounded: `sm:rounded-[16px]`
- Backdrop: `bg-black/70 backdrop-blur-sm`

**Form Inputs** (from ContactModal):
```javascript
// Shared class
'w-full rounded-[10px] px-4 py-3 text-[13px] font-geist text-white/80 placeholder:text-white/20 outline-none transition-all duration-200'

// Inline style
{
  background: 'radial-gradient(ellipse at 50% 0%, #1e1e1e 0%, #161616 100%)',
  border: '1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.06)',
  boxShadow: 'inset 0 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.3), inset 0 -1px 0 rgba(255,255,255,0.03)',
}
```

**Navigation Classes**:
- Base nav: `absolute top-0 left-0 right-0 z-[101]`
- Inner container: `mx-auto max-w-[1200px] rounded-xl px-6 py-3 flex items-center justify-between`
- Hover state: `md:group-hover:bg-[#1a1a1a]/95 md:group-hover:backdrop-blur-md`
- Mobile nav: `fixed inset-0 z-[100] bg-ob-bg flex flex-col`

---

### 5. **Animation & Effects**

**Custom Keyframes** (in `/src/index.css`):

```css
@keyframes breathe {
  0%, 100% { opacity: 0.5; }
  50% { opacity: 0.7; }
}

@keyframes led-glow {
  0%, 100% { box-shadow: 0 0 4px rgba(254,0,122,0.5), 0 0 8px rgba(254,0,122,0.15); }
  50% { box-shadow: 0 0 6px rgba(254,0,122,0.7), 0 0 12px rgba(254,0,122,0.25); }
}

/* Applied classes */
.node-dot { animation: breathe 3s ease-in-out infinite; }
.status-led { animation: led-glow 2s ease-in-out infinite; }
```

**Button Interactions** (`.cta-btn`):
```css
.cta-btn {
  transition: all 0.15s ease;
}

.cta-btn:hover {
  transform: translateY(-1px);
  filter: brightness(1.05);
  box-shadow: inset 0 1px 0 rgba(255,255,255,0.3),
              inset 0 -2px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15),
              0 6px 20px rgba(254,0,122,0.35),
              0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.4);
}

.cta-btn:active {
  transform: translateY(1px);
  filter: brightness(0.97);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.2),
              0 1px 4px rgba(254,0,122,0.15),
              0 1px 2px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);
}
```

**Motion Library Patterns** (from framer motion alternative):
- `initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 6 }}`
- `animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }}`
- `exit={{ opacity: 0, y: -6 }}`
- `transition={{ duration: 0.2 }}`
- Stagger animations: `staggerChildren: 0.08`

**Reduced Motion Support**:
```css
@media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) {
  *, *::before, *::after {
    animation-duration: 0.01ms !important;
    transition-duration: 0.01ms !important;
  }
}
```

---

### 6. **Spacing & Layout Patterns**

**Container Max-Width**: `max-w-[1200px]`

**Common Spacing**:
- Section padding: `px-6 py-16 md:py-32` or `px-6 pt-40 pb-10`
- Gap values: `gap-3`, `gap-4`, `gap-6`, `gap-8`, `gap-1.5`
- Padding: `px-4 py-3`, `px-6 py-4`, `p-5 sm:p-7`, `p-6 sm:p-8`

**Responsive Patterns**:
- Mobile-first with `max-md:`, `md:`, `max-sm:`, `sm:` breakpoints
- Example: `text-[32px] md:text-[57.5px]`
- Flex wrapping: `flex-col md:flex-row`

**Grid Layouts** (Comparisons modal):
```javascript
className="grid grid-cols-[72px_1fr_1fr] sm:grid-cols-[140px_1fr_1fr] gap-2 sm:gap-4"
```

---

### 7. **Visual Theme & Brand Identity**

**Theme**: **Dark mode dominated** with metallic/skeuomorphic accents

**Primary Visual Characteristics**:
1. **Very dark background** (#0D0D0D) — almost black
2. **High contrast text** — white with opacity variations for hierarchy
3. **Gradient text** — glossy white-to-transparent gradients for headings
4. **Metallic elements** — used in buttons, success states, and metal emblem effects
5. **Noise texture overlay** — subtle fractal noise on panels (`.panel-surface::after`)
6. **Pink/Magenta accents** (#FE007A) — for interactive states and LEDs
7. **Soft shadows** — inset shadows for depth, outer shadows for floating elements
8. **Smooth blur effects** — `backdrop-blur-md` on hover states

**Metal/Skeuomorphic Styling** (Success state):
```javascript
// Metal emblem background
background: 'radial-gradient(ellipse at 40% 30%, #c0c0c0 0%, #999 40%, #707070 80%, #585858 100%)',
boxShadow: 'inset 0 2px 0 rgba(255,255,255,0.4), inset 0 -2px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.2), 0 4px 16px rgba(0,0,0,0.5)',

// Metal plate with engraving
background: 'linear-gradient(145deg, #bfbfbf 0%, #a6a6a6 35%, #969696 60%, #8a8a8a 100%)',
boxShadow: 'inset 0 1px 0 rgba(255,255,255,0.35), inset 0 -2px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.12), 0 4px 20px rgba(0,0,0,0.5)',
textShadow: '0 1px 0 rgba(255,255,255,0.5), 0 -0.5px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15)',
```

---

### 8. **Special Effects & Advanced Styling**

**Beam/Light Effect** (Hero section):
- Polygonal clip paths for directional light beams
- Radial gradients for glow effects
- Blur filters on layered divs
- Calculated positions using JavaScript

**Dot Grid** (Background):
- Uses `@paper-design/shaders-react` DotGrid component
- Perspective transforms and 3D rotation
- Smooth animation transitions (600ms easing)
- Dynamic scaling based on hover state

**Smooth Scrolling**:
- Integrated **Lenis** smooth scroll library
- Applied globally via `new Lenis()` in App.tsx

**Code Terminal Styling** (CodeSnippet component):
```javascript
const PROMPT = 'select-none text-white/35'
const SYS = 'text-white/35'
const OP = 'text-white/50'
const ACCENT = 'text-white/90'
const KW = 'text-white font-bold'
const FN = 'text-white/70'
const BORDER = 'text-white/20'
```

---

### 9. **Design System Dependencies**

**Key Libraries**:
- `tailwindcss` v4.1.18
- `@tailwindcss/vite` v4.1.18
- `motion` v12.34.0 (for animations)
- `lenis` v1.3.17 (smooth scrolling)

- `geist` v1.7.0 (font system)

**Flexbox & Grid**:
- `flex items-center justify-between`, `flex items-center gap-4`
- `grid grid-cols-[...] gap-X`
- `flex-col md:flex-row`

**Text Classes**:
- `font-geist`, `font-semibold`, `font-medium`, `font-mono`, `font-bold`
- `text-[14px]`, `text-[18px]`, `text-center`, `text-ob-light`
- `tracking-[-0.03em]`, `tracking-[0.06em]`, `leading-[1.04]`
- `uppercase`, `whitespace-nowrap`

**Spacing**:
- `px-4 py-3`, `px-6 py-4`, `mb-3`, `mt-2`, `gap-1.5`, `gap-6`

**Borders & Shadows**:
- `border border-white/[0.08]`, `border-t border-white/6`
- `rounded-[13.5px]`, `rounded-[10px]`, `rounded-full`
- `shadow-[inset_...]` for custom inset shadows

**Visibility & Interaction**:
- `opacity-0`, `opacity-100`, `pointer-events-none`, `cursor-pointer`
- `hover:text-white/40`, `hover:brightness-110`
- `transition-all duration-200`, `transition-opacity duration-150`
- `disabled:opacity-50`

		Public docs live here. Internal planning docs remain outside this app.
	</Card>
</CardGrid>

	window.StarlightThemeProvider = (() => {
		const storedTheme =
			typeof localStorage !== 'undefined' && localStorage.getItem('starlight-theme');
		const theme =
			storedTheme ||
			(window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: light)').matches ? 'light' : 'dark');
		document.documentElement.dataset.theme = theme === 'light' ? 'light' : 'dark';
		return {
			updatePickers(theme = storedTheme || 'auto') {
				document.querySelectorAll('starlight-theme-select').forEach((picker) => {
					const select = picker.querySelector('select');
					if (select) select.value = theme;
					/** @type {HTMLTemplateElement | null} */
					const tmpl = document.querySelector(`#theme-icons`);
					const newIcon = tmpl && tmpl.content.querySelector('.' + theme);
					if (newIcon) {
						const oldIcon = picker.querySelector('svg.label-icon');
						if (oldIcon) {
							oldIcon.replaceChildren(...newIcon.cloneNode(true).childNodes);
						}
					}
				});
			},
		};
	})();

@font-face {
	font-family: 'Geist';
	src: url('/fonts/Geist-Variable.woff2') format('woff2');

	font-display: swap;
}

@font-face {
	font-family: 'Geist Mono';
	src: url('/fonts/GeistMono-Variable.woff2') format('woff2');
	font-weight: 100 900;
	font-display: swap;
}

/* ── ObsessionDB theme for Starlight ──────────────── */
/* Colors derived from ob-db landing page:
   --color-ob-bg:        #0D0D0D  (near-black background)
   --color-ob-light:     #E8E7E3  (warm off-white)
   --color-ob-dark:      #272727  (dark surface)
   --color-ob-text-dark: #170A16  (text on light)
   --color-ob-subtitle:  #808080  (muted text)
   accent:               #FE007A  (pink/magenta)
*/

:root {
	/* Font overrides */
	--sl-font: 'Geist', sans-serif;
	--sl-font-mono: 'Geist Mono', monospace;

	/* Dark mode color scale (ob-db palette) */
	--sl-color-white: #E8E7E3;
	--sl-color-gray-1: #BFBEBB;
	--sl-color-gray-2: #9A9996;
	--sl-color-gray-3: #808080;
	--sl-color-gray-4: #525252;
	--sl-color-gray-5: #2A2A2A;
	--sl-color-gray-6: #1A1A1A;
	--sl-color-black: #0D0D0D;

	/* Accent — pink/magenta from ob-db LED glow */
	--sl-color-accent-low: hsl(336, 80%, 16%);
	--sl-color-accent: #FE007A;
	--sl-color-accent-high: hsl(336, 100%, 82%);

	/* Semantic mappings */
	--sl-color-text: var(--sl-color-gray-2);
	--sl-color-text-accent: var(--sl-color-accent-high);
	--sl-color-bg: var(--sl-color-black);
	--sl-color-bg-nav: #141414;
	--sl-color-bg-sidebar: #141414;
	--sl-color-bg-inline-code: #1E1E1E;

<!DOCTYPE html><html lang="en" dir="ltr" data-theme="dark" data-has-hero class="astro-k2ypt5dw"> <head><meta charset="utf-8"/><meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1"/><title>chkit Documentation | chkit Docs</title><link rel="shortcut icon" href="/favicon.svg" type="image/svg+xml"/><meta name="generator" content="Astro v5.17.2"/><meta name="generator" content="Starlight v0.37.6"/><meta property="og:title" content="chkit Documentation"/><meta property="og:type" content="article"/><meta property="og:locale" content="en"/><meta property="og:description" content="Public docs for chkit, a ClickHouse schema and migration CLI for TypeScript projects."/><meta property="og:site_name" content="chkit Docs"/><meta name="twitter:card" content="summary_large_image"/><meta name="description" content="Public docs for chkit, a ClickHouse schema and migration CLI for TypeScript projects."/><script>
	window.StarlightThemeProvider = (() => {
		const storedTheme =
			typeof localStorage !== 'undefined' && localStorage.getItem('starlight-theme');
		const theme =
			storedTheme ||
			(window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: light)').matches ? 'light' : 'dark');
		document.documentElement.dataset.theme = theme === 'light' ? 'light' : 'dark';
		return {
			updatePickers(theme = storedTheme || 'auto') {
				document.querySelectorAll('starlight-theme-select').forEach((picker) => {
					const select = picker.querySelector('select');
					if (select) select.value = theme;
					/** @type {HTMLTemplateElement | null} */
					const tmpl = document.querySelector(`#theme-icons`);
					const newIcon = tmpl && tmpl.content.querySelector('.' + theme);
					if (newIcon) {
						const oldIcon = picker.querySelector('svg.label-icon');
						if (oldIcon) {
							oldIcon.replaceChildren(...newIcon.cloneNode(true).childNodes);
						}
					}
				});
			},
		};
	})();
</script><template id="theme-icons" @font-face {
	font-family: 'Geist';
	src: url('/fonts/Geist-Variable.woff2') format('woff2');
	font-weight: 100 900;
	font-display: swap;
}

@font-face {
	font-family: 'Geist Mono';
	src: url('/fonts/GeistMono-Variable.woff2') format('woff2');
	font-weight: 100 900;
	font-display: swap;
}

/* ── ObsessionDB theme for Starlight ──────────────── */
/* Colors derived from ob-db landing page:
   --color-ob-bg:        #0D0D0D  (near-black background)
   --color-ob-light:     #E8E7E3  (warm off-white)
   --color-ob-dark:      #272727  (dark surface)
   --color-ob-text-dark: #170A16  (text on light)
   --color-ob-subtitle:  #808080  (muted text)
   accent:               #FE007A  (pink/magenta)
*/

:root {
	/* Font overrides */
	--sl-font: 'Geist', sans-serif;
	--sl-font-mono: 'Geist Mono', monospace;

	/* Dark mode color scale (ob-db palette) */
	--sl-color-white: #E8E7E3;
	--sl-color-gray-1: #BFBEBB;
	--sl-color-gray-2: #9A9996;
	--sl-color-gray-3: #808080;
	--sl-color-gray-4: #525252;
	--sl-color-gray-5: #2A2A2A;
	--sl-color-gray-6: #1A1A1A;
	--sl-color-black: #0D0D0D;

	/* Accent — pink/magenta from ob-db LED glow */
	--sl-color-accent-low: hsl(336, 80%, 16%);
	--sl-color-accent: #FE007A;
	--sl-color-accent-high: hsl(336, 100%, 82%);

	/* Semantic mappings */
	--sl-color-text: var(--sl-color-gray-2);
	--sl-color-text-accent: var(--sl-color-accent-high);
	--sl-color-bg: var(--sl-color-black);
	--sl-color-bg-nav: #141414;
	--sl-color-bg-sidebar: #141414;
	--sl-color-bg-inline-code: #1E1E1E;
	--sl-color-bg-accent: var(--sl-color-accent);

content.text:
Here's a summary of what I did to apply the ob-db landing page styling to the Starlight docs:

### Changes Made

**1. Copied Geist fonts** to `apps/docs/public/fonts/`
- `Geist-Variable.woff2` (sans-serif)
- `GeistMono-Variable.woff2` (monospace)

**2. Created `apps/docs/src/styles/custom.css`** with:
- **@font-face** declarations for Geist and Geist Mono variable fonts
- **Color overrides** mapped from ob-db's design tokens:
  - Background: `#0D0D0D` (near-black, matching `--color-ob-bg`)
  - Nav/sidebar: `#141414` (matching ob-db modal/dialog background)
  - Text: warm gray scale derived from `#E8E7E3` (ob-light) through `#808080` (ob-subtitle)
  - Accent: `#FE007A` (the pink/magenta from ob-db's LED glow effects)
  - Borders: `rgba(255,255,255,0.06-0.08)` matching ob-db's `border-white/[0.08]` pattern
- **Force dark-mode only** — overrides light mode variables to match dark, hides theme toggle
- **Typography refinements** — `letter-spacing: -0.03em` on headings, `font-weight: 600` (matching ob-db patterns)
- **Code block styling** — dark terminal aesthetic with `#141414` background
- **Subtle shadows** matching ob-db's dark UI approach

**3. Updated `astro.config.mjs`** — added `customCss: ['./src/styles/custom.css']` to the Starlight config

The docs now use the same visual identity as the landing page: Geist font, near-black background, warm off-white text, pink accent color, and subtle `rgba` borders throughout.

content.content:
# CHX Public Docs

This folder contains the public documentation website for CHX, powered by Astro + Starlight.

Public docs content lives in `src/content/docs/`.

Internal planning/spec documents are intentionally kept in the repository-level `/docs` folder and are not part of this site by default.

## Commands

- `bun run docs:dev` (from repo root): start local docs server at `localhost:4321`
- `bun run docs:build` (from repo root): build production docs site

content.content:
1→---
     2→title: chkit Documentation
     3→description: Public docs for chkit, a ClickHouse schema and migration CLI for TypeScript projects.
     4→template: splash
     5→hero:
     6→  tagline: Run schema changes with confidence.
     7→  actions:
     8→    - text: Getting Started
     9→      link: /getting-started/
    10→      icon: right-arrow
    11→    - text: CLI Overview
    12→      link: /cli/overview/
    13→      icon: right-arrow
    14→---
    15→
    16→import { Card, CardGrid } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
    17→
    18→## What you will find here
    19→
    20→<CardGrid stagger>
    21→	<Card title="Quick Start" icon="rocket">
    22→		Install chkit with Bun and run your first migration workflow.
    23→	</Card>
    24→	<Card title="CLI Reference" icon="seti:terminal">
    25→		Learn each command, expected output, and operational behavior.
    26→	</Card>
    27→	<Card title="Config Guide" icon="setting">
    28→		Use `clickhouse.config.ts` to wire schema, migration paths, and safety settings.
    29→	</Card>
    30→	<Card title="Docs Structure" icon="tree-structure">
    31→		Public docs live here. Internal planning docs remain outside this app.
    32→	</Card>
    33→</CardGrid>
    34→

content.content:
1→---
     2→title: Getting Started
     3→description: Install chkit and run the first migration flow.
     4→---
     5→
     6→## Prerequisites
     7→
     8→- Bun `1.3.5+`
     9→- A ClickHouse endpoint
    10→
    11→## Install
    12→
    13→```bash
    14→bun install
    15→bun run build
    16→bun run chkit --help
    17→```
    18→
    19→## Quick Start
    20→
    21→```bash
    22→bun run chkit init
    23→bun run chkit generate --name init
    24→bun run chkit migrate
    25→bun run chkit migrate --apply
    26→bun run chkit status
    27→bun run chkit check
    28→```
    29→
    30→## Next
    31→
    32→- Continue to [CLI Overview](/cli/overview/)
    33→- Continue to [Config Overview](/configuration/overview/)
    34→

content.content: # Starlight Starlight is a documentation website framework for [Astro][astro]. ## Documentation [Read the Starlight docs][docs] (they’re built with Starlight!) ## Support Get help in the [Astro Discord][discord]. Post questions in our `#support` forum with the “starlight” tag, or visit our dedicated `#starlight` channel to discuss current development and more! You can also submit bug reports and feature requests as [GitHub issues][issues]. ## Contributing Join us as a Starlight contributor! These links will help you get started: - [Contributor Manual][contributing] - [Code of Conduct][coc] - [Community Guide][community] - [Join the `#starlight` channel on Discord][discord] ## License MIT Copyright (c) 2023–present [Starlight contributors][contributors] [astro]: https://astro.build/ [docs]: https://starlight.astro.build/ [contributing]: https://github.com/withastro/starlight/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md [coc]: https://github.com/withastro/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md [community]: https://github.com/withastro/.github/blob/main/COMMUNITY_GUIDE.md [contributors]: https://github.com/withastro/starlight/graphs/contributors [discord]: https://astro.build/chat/ [issues]: https://github.com/withastro/starlight/issues

content.content:
1→---
     2→title: Documentation Structure
     3→description: Scope boundaries between public docs and internal planning docs.
     4→---
     5→
     6→To keep documentation maintainable, CHX uses two separate doc surfaces:
     7→
     8→## Public Documentation (this site)
     9→
    10→Location: `apps/docs/src/content/docs`
    11→
    12→Contains:
    13→- End-user guides
    14→- CLI and configuration reference
    15→- Plugin usage documentation
    16→- Operational usage and troubleshooting
    17→
    18→Rules:
    19→- Audience is users of CHX
    20→- Prefer stable, task-oriented content
    21→- Avoid roadmap and speculative details
    22→
    23→## Internal Planning
    24→
    25→Location: `planning/`
    26→
    27→Contains:
    28→- Deferred feature specs
    29→- Internal architecture notes
    30→- Reference contracts (JSON output, internal structure)
    31→
    32→Rules:
    33→- Audience is maintainers/contributors
    34→- Can include in-progress ideas and execution notes
    35→- Not published in the public docs app
    36→
    37→## Rule of Thumb
    38→
    39→If a page answers "How do I use CHX?", it belongs in public docs.
    40→If a page answers "How are we planning/building CHX internally?", it belongs in planning.
    41→

content.content:
1→---
     2→title: CLI Overview
     3→description: Command surface of the chkit CLI.
     4→---
     5→
     6→## Commands
     7→
     8→- `chkit init`
     9→- `chkit generate [--name <migration-name>] [--migration-id <id>] [--config <path>] [--dryrun] [--json]`
    10→- `chkit codegen [--check] [--out-file <path>] [--emit-zod] [--no-emit-zod] [--emit-ingest] [--no-emit-ingest] [--ingest-out-file <path>] [--bigint-mode <string|bigint>] [--include-views] [--config <path>] [--json]`
    11→- `chkit migrate [--config <path>] [--apply|--execute] [--allow-destructive] [--json]`
    12→- `chkit status [--config <path>] [--json]`
    13→- `chkit drift [--config <path>] [--json]`
    14→- `chkit check [--config <path>] [--strict] [--json]`
    15→- `chkit plugin [<plugin-name> [<command> ...]] [--config <path>] [--json]`
    16→- `chkit version`
    17→
    18→## Global Flags
    19→
    20→- `--config <path>`: config file path (default `clickhouse.config.ts`)
    21→- `--json`: machine-readable output
    22→

content.content:
1→---
     2→title: "Configuration Overview"
     3→description: "clickhouse.config.ts structure and defaults."
     4→---
     5→
     6→`chkit` is configured through `clickhouse.config.ts`.
     7→
     8→## Core Fields
     9→
    10→- `schema`: glob path to schema files
    11→- `outDir`: root folder for generated artifacts
    12→- `migrationsDir`: SQL migration file folder
    13→- `metaDir`: state folder (`snapshot.json`, `journal.json`)
    14→- `plugins`: plugin registrations
    15→- `clickhouse`: live connection options
    16→- `check`: CI gate behavior
    17→- `safety`: destructive migration safety behavior
    18→
    19→## Example
    20→
    21→```ts
    22→import { defineConfig } from '@chkit/core'
    23→
    24→export default defineConfig({
    25→  schema: './src/db/schema/**/*.ts',
    26→  outDir: './chkit',
    27→  migrationsDir: './chkit/migrations',
    28→  metaDir: './chkit/meta',
    29→  clickhouse: {
    30→    url: process.env.CLICKHOUSE_URL ?? 'http://localhost:8123',
    31→    username: process.env.CLICKHOUSE_USER ?? 'default',
    32→    password: process.env.CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD ?? '',
    33→    database: process.env.CLICKHOUSE_DB ?? 'default',
    34→  },
    35→})
    36→```
    37→

content.content:
1→---
     2→name: library-docs
     3→description: CRITICAL - Fetch real-time, official library documentation instead of relying on potentially outdated training data. Use WHENEVER working with ANY external library, framework, or package (React, Vue, Express, etc.) to get the latest APIs, usage patterns, and best practices directly from authoritative sources. Essential for accurate implementation - your training data may be months or years old, but this fetches current docs.
     4→allowed-tools: mcp__context7__resolve-library-id, mcp__context7__get-library-docs
     5→---
     6→
     7→# Library Documentation Research
     8→
     9→## What I Do
    10→
    11→Fetch up-to-date, official library documentation to ensure you're using current APIs and patterns rather than potentially outdated training data. Training data can be months or years old - this skill retrieves the latest documentation directly from authoritative sources.
    12→
    13→## Core Process
    14→
    15→### 1. Library Resolution Pattern
    16→
    17→Always resolve the library ID first unless explicitly provided:
    18→
    19→```
    20→1. Call mcp__context7__resolve-library-id with the library name
    21→2. Evaluate matches based on:
    22→   - Name similarity (exact matches preferred)
    23→   - Description relevance
    24→   - Documentation coverage (higher snippet counts = better)
    25→   - Trust score (7-10 indicates authoritative source)
    26→3. Select the most relevant match
    27→```
    28→
    29→### 2. Documentation Retrieval Pattern
    30→
    31→Once you have the library ID:
    32→
    33→```
    34→1. Call mcp__context7__get-library-docs with:
    35→   - context7CompatibleLibraryID: The resolved ID
    36→   - topic: Specific feature/API if needed (optional)
    37→   - tokens: 5000 default, up to 10000 for comprehensive coverage
    38→2. Process the returned documentation
    39→3. Extract relevant sections for the query
    40→```
    41→
    42→## Search Strategies
    43→
    44→### For API Documentation
    45→
    46→- **Libraries**: "react", "next.js", "vue", "express", "fastify"
    47→- **Topics**: "hooks", "routing", "middleware", "components"
    48→- **Token Strategy**: Use 7000-10000 for comprehensive API coverage
    49→
    50→### For Implementation Patterns
    51→
    52→- **Focus topics**: "authentication", "state-management", "error-handling"
    53→- **Look for**: Code examples, usage patterns, best practices
    54→- **Token Strategy**: 5000 usually sufficient for focused topics
    55→
    56→### For Version-Specific Information
    57→
    58→- **Format**: `/org/project/version` (e.g., `/vercel/next.js/v14.3.0`)
    59→- **Key areas**: Breaking changes, migration guides, new features
    60→- **Token Strategy**: Increase tokens for migration guides
    61→
    62→## Common Library IDs
    63→
    64→### Claude Code Documentation
    65→
    66→- Claude Code: `/websites/claude_en_claude-code` (410+ code snippets for Claude Code features)
    67→
    68→### Frontend Frameworks & State Management
    69→
    70→- React: `/websites/react_dev` (1923 snippets, trust 9) or `/reactjs/react.dev` (2836 snippets, trust 10)
    71→- TanStack Router: `/tanstack/router` (1307 snippets, trust 8)
    72→- TanStack Query: `/tanstack/query` (749 snippets, trust 8) or `/websites/tanstack_query_v5` (4508 snippets)
    73→- Zustand: `/pmndrs/zustand` (462 snippets, trust 9.6)
    74→
    75→### Backend Frameworks
    76→
    77→- Hono: `/honojs/website` (740 snippets) or `/llmstxt/hono_dev_llms_txt` (1768 snippets)
    78→- oRPC: `/unnoq/orpc` (531 snippets, trust 9.4)
    79→- Better Auth: `/better-auth/better-auth` (1301 snippets, trust 7.6)
    80→
    81→### Databases & ORMs
    82→
    83→- PostgreSQL: `/postgres/postgres` (18 snippets, trust 8.4) or `/porsager/postgres` (178 snippets, JS client)
    84→- ClickHouse: `/clickhouse/clickhouse` (9889 snippets, trust 9.4)
    85→- Drizzle ORM: `/drizzle-team/drizzle-orm` (436 snippets, trust 7.6)
    86→
    87→### Build Tools & Runtimes
    88→
    89→- Vite: `/vitejs/vite` (480 snippets, trust 8.3)
    90→- Turborepo: `/vercel/turborepo` (822 snippets, trust 10)
    91→- Bun: `/oven-sh/bun` (2377 snippets, trust 9.4)
    92→- ESLint: `/eslint/eslint` (2853 snippets, trust 9.1)
    93→- TypeScript: `/microsoft/typescript` (15930 snippets, trust 9.9)
    94→
    95→### Testing Tools
    96→
    97→- Vitest: `/vitest-dev/vitest` (1183 snippets, trust 8.3)
    98→
    99→### Cloud & Infrastructure
   100→
   101→- Supabase: `/supabase/supabase` (4552 snippets, trust 10)
   102→- Cloudflare Workers: `/cloudflare/workers-sdk` (266 snippets, trust 9.3)
   103→- Google Cloud Platform: `/googleapis/google-cloud-node` (1610 snippets, trust 8.5)
   104→
   105→## Output Format Template
   106→
   107→```markdown
   108→## Library: [Name] ([Context7 ID])
   109→
   110→**Version**: [If specified]
   111→**Topic**: [If focused]
   112→
   113→### Key APIs/Features
   114→
   115→#### [Feature Name]
   116→
   117→**Purpose**: [What it does]
   118→**Usage**:
   119→\`\`\`javascript
   120→[Code example]
   121→\`\`\`
   122→**Parameters**: [If relevant]
   123→**Returns**: [If relevant]
   124→
   125→### Implementation Examples
   126→
   127→[Relevant code examples from docs]
   128→
   129→### Best Practices
   130→
   131→- [Practice 1 from official docs]
   132→- [Practice 2 from official docs]
   133→
   134→### Related Documentation
   135→
   136→- [Other relevant sections to explore]
   137→```
   138→
   139→## Error Handling
   140→
   141→### Library Not Found
   142→
   143→If resolve-library-id returns no matches:
   144→
   145→1. Try alternative names (e.g., "nodejs" vs "node")
   146→2. Check if it's a sub-package (e.g., "@react/router")
   147→3. Suggest using web search for newer/niche libraries
   148→
   149→### Insufficient Documentation
   150→
   151→If documentation is sparse:
   152→
   153→1. Try broader topic searches
   154→2. Increase token limit
   155→3. Consider multiple queries for different aspects
   156→4. Fall back to web search for community resources
   157→
   158→## When to Use This Skill vs Training Data or Web Search
   159→
   160→**ALWAYS use this skill FIRST for:**
   161→
   162→- ANY library or framework you're about to use (React, Vue, Next.js, Express, etc.)
   163→- Getting current API signatures and methods
   164→- Understanding the latest best practices
   165→- Checking if APIs have changed since your training cutoff
   166→- Verifying correct usage patterns before writing code
   167→- Claude Code documentation (`/websites/claude_en_claude-code`)
   168→
   169→**Why not rely on training data:**
   170→
   171→- Your training data may be months or years old
   172→- Libraries update frequently with breaking changes
   173→- New features and patterns emerge constantly
   174→- Deprecated methods may still be in your training data
   175→- Best practices evolve - what was correct may now be anti-pattern
   176→
   177→**Use web search only when:**
   178→
   179→- The library isn't indexed (try this skill first)
   180→- You need community tutorials and guides
   181→- Looking for real-world implementation stories
   182→- Troubleshooting specific error messages
   183→- Comparing multiple libraries
   184→
   185→## Integration Tips
   186→
   187→### With Codebase Analysis
   188→
   189→- Use to understand external dependencies
   190→- Clarify API usage in existing code
   191→- Verify version compatibility
   192→- Find migration paths for updates
   193→
   194→### With Implementation Planning
   195→
   196→- Get official patterns before coding
   197→- Understand API contracts
   198→- Find recommended approaches
   199→- Identify potential gotchas
   200→
   201→### Performance Optimization
   202→
   203→- Cache resolved library IDs mentally
   204→- Use focused topics to reduce tokens
   205→- Make multiple targeted queries vs one large query
   206→- Start with 5000 tokens, increase only if needed
   207→
   208→## Examples
   209→
   210→### Example 1: React Hooks Documentation
   211→
   212→```
   213→1. Direct retrieve (use verified ID): mcp__context7__get-library-docs(
   214→     context7CompatibleLibraryID="/reactjs/react.dev",
   215→     topic="hooks",
   216→     tokens=7000
   217→   )
   218→2. Extract: useState, useEffect, useContext, custom hooks patterns
   219→```
   220→
   221→### Example 2: TanStack Query Data Fetching
   222→
   223→```
   224→1. Direct retrieve (use verified ID): mcp__context7__get-library-docs(
   225→     context7CompatibleLibraryID="/websites/tanstack_query_v5",
   226→     topic="queries mutations",

file.content:
---
title: chkit Documentation
description: Public docs for chkit, a ClickHouse schema and migration CLI for TypeScript projects.
template: splash
hero:
  tagline: Run schema changes with confidence.
  actions:
    - text: Getting Started
      link: /getting-started/
      icon: right-arrow
    - text: CLI Overview
      link: /cli/overview/
      icon: right-arrow
---

import { Card, CardGrid } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

## What you will find here

<CardGrid stagger>
	<Card title="Quick Start" icon="rocket">
		Install chkit with Bun and run your first migration workflow.
	</Card>
	<Card title="CLI Reference" icon="seti:terminal">
		Learn each command, expected output, and operational behavior.
	</Card>
	<Card title="Config Guide" icon="setting">
		Use `clickhouse.config.ts` to wire schema, migration paths, and safety settings.
	</Card>
	<Card title="Schema Reference" icon="document">
		Define tables, views, and materialized views with the TypeScript DSL.
	</Card>
	<Card title="Docs Structure" icon="tree-structure">
		Public docs live here. Internal planning docs remain outside this app.
	</Card>
</CardGrid>

content.text:
Build is clean. Here's what changed:

**Color neutralization:**
- All semantic colors (orange, green, blue, purple, red) replaced with monochrome grays (`#808080` borders, `#1E1E1E` backgrounds, `#E8E7E3` highlights)
- Accent color shifted from the bright pink `#FE007A` to a muted warm gray `#9A9996` — keeps the hierarchy without the color pop
- Card icons now use subtle `rgba(255,255,255,0.1)` borders on dark `#1E1E1E` backgrounds instead of the cycling purple/orange/green/red

**Hero buttons restyled to match ob-db:**
- Primary: warm off-white (`#E8E7E3`) background with dark text — mirrors the ob-db light button variant with the same inset shadows
- Secondary: dark surface (`#272727`) with light text — mirrors the ob-db dark button variant
- Both get the subtle `translateY(-1px)` hover lift from the landing page

**Links:** Underline color shifted from pink to warm white at 30% opacity.

The whole page should now feel monochrome and cohesive with the landing page's dark, understated aesthetic.

content.content:
1→---
     2→title: chkit Documentation
     3→description: Public docs for chkit, a ClickHouse schema and migration CLI for TypeScript projects.
     4→template: splash
     5→hero:
     6→  tagline: Run schema changes with confidence.
     7→  actions:
     8→    - text: Getting Started
     9→      link: /getting-started/
    10→      icon: right-arrow
    11→    - text: CLI Overview
    12→      link: /cli/overview/
    13→      icon: right-arrow
    14→---
    15→
    16→import { Card, CardGrid } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
    17→
    18→## What you will find here
    19→
    20→<CardGrid stagger>
    21→	<Card title="Quick Start" icon="rocket">
    22→		Install chkit with Bun and run your first migration workflow.
    23→	</Card>
    24→	<Card title="CLI Reference" icon="seti:terminal">
    25→		Learn each command, expected output, and operational behavior.
    26→	</Card>
    27→	<Card title="Config Guide" icon="setting">
    28→		Use `clickhouse.config.ts` to wire schema, migration paths, and safety settings.
    29→	</Card>
    30→	<Card title="Schema Reference" icon="document">
    31→		Define tables, views, and materialized views with the TypeScript DSL.
    32→	</Card>
    33→	<Card title="Docs Structure" icon="tree-structure">
    34→		Public docs live here. Internal planning docs remain outside this app.
    35→	</Card>
    36→</CardGrid>
    37→

file.content:
---
title: chkit Documentation
description: Public docs for chkit, a ClickHouse schema and migration CLI for TypeScript projects.
template: splash
hero:
  tagline: Run schema changes with confidence.
  actions:
    - text: Getting Started
      link: /getting-started/
      icon: right-arrow
    - text: CLI Overview
      link: /cli/overview/
      icon: right-arrow
---

import { Card, CardGrid } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

## What you will find here
